1.description: A wizard of Unseen University known for his cowardice and tendency to run away from danger. Wears a battered pointed hat with 'WIZZARD' written on it.

3.description: Possesses The Spell, one of the eight Great Spells, lodged in his mind. This makes him immune to certain magical effects but prevents him from learning other magic.

2.description: A young boy with incredible magical power who arrives at Unseen University. Has golden hair and carries a staff.

5.description: Revealed to be a sourcerer - an eighth son of an eighth son of an eighth son. His power far exceeds that of normal wizards.

8.description: The staff he carries contains the spirit of his father, Ipslore the Red, who guides and controls much of his actions.

6.description: A beautiful woman with incredible fighting skills. Despite her appearance, she is deadly with weapons and has barbarian instincts.

7.description: Daughter of Cohen the Barbarian. She inherited his fighting abilities but wishes she could be more feminine and domestic.
A young man who wants to be a barbarian hero but is hopelessly inept at it. Carries a book on how to be a barbarian.

8.description: His only heroic deed so far was destroying a nest of wasps, earning him the title 'Destroyer of Scorpions' through exaggeration.

1.description: A chest made from sapient pearwood that follows Rincewind everywhere. It has hundreds of little legs and can be quite violent when protecting its owner.

4.description: Contains an extradimensional space inside and has a tendency to eat people who threaten Rincewind. Shows emotional attachment despite being luggage.

1.description: A dead wizard whose spirit inhabits a staff. He was once a powerful wizard who was cast out from the order.

8.description: Father of Coin the Sourcerer. He bound his spirit to a staff to guide his son and achieve revenge against the wizarding establishment.

2.description: The Bursar of Unseen University. A nervous wizard who keeps track of the university's finances and administration.
The Librarian of Unseen University, who was transformed into an orangutan by a magical accident. He prefers his current form and communicates mainly in 'ook'.

9.description: The Seriph of Al Khali, a ruler obsessed with poetry and beautiful things. He lives in luxury in his palace surrounded by fountains and gardens.
The Grand Vizier of Al Khali, a scheming man who serves the Seriph but has his own ambitions for power.

19.description: The ruler of Ankh-Morpork, known for his cunning and ability to maintain order through careful manipulation and political skill.

21.description: The anthropomorphic personification of Death. A tall, thin figure in a black robe who speaks in capital letters and takes a professional interest in mortality.
One of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. Appears as a large, aggressive figure eager for conflict and battle.
One of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. Obsessed with dieting and healthy eating, despite representing hunger and starvation.
One of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. Represents disease and plague, often appearing sickly and covered in boils.

2.description: A Dean at Unseen University, one of the senior wizards who helps run the institution. Known for his administrative duties.
Another Dean at Unseen University, part of the senior faculty. Often involved in university politics and magical research.
A senior wizard at Unseen University with the title of Doctor. Part of the university's academic hierarchy.
A wizard at Unseen University, part of the faculty who witnesses the arrival of the Sourcerer.
Another wizard of Unseen University, present during the important events surrounding the Sourcerer's arrival.

9.description: A guard in Al Khali, one of the palace guards who serves the Seriph and maintains order in the city.

5.description: A wizard who becomes involved in the magical conflicts that arise from the Sourcerer's influence on the wizarding world.
A wizard involved in the growing magical war as wizards begin fighting each other under the influence of sourcery.

6.description: A thief in Ankh-Morpork, one of the criminal element that operates in the city's underworld.

8.description: A wizard who participates in the magical warfare that breaks out as sourcery influences wizards to seek power and domination.

2.description: An extremely elderly wizard at Unseen University, so old that he's practically deaf and blind but still serves as faculty.

6.description: A trader from the continent of Klatch who deals in exotic goods and travels between various countries and cities.

4.description: A guard stationed at the Tower of Art in Unseen University, responsible for security in one of the most important magical buildings.

2.description: The financial administrator of Unseen University, responsible for managing the institution's money and resources.
A senior academic position at Unseen University, one of the wizards who helps govern the institution.
A professor at Unseen University who holds the academic position dealing with vague and uncertain magical phenomena.
An academic at Unseen University specializing in the study of modern runic magic and writing systems.

professor-of-cruel-and-unusual-geography.name: Professor of Cruel and Unusual Geography

2.description: A professor at Unseen University who studies the more dangerous and bizarre geographical features of the Disc.
The former head of Unseen University, displaced when the Sourcerer takes control of the institution.

9.description: The leader of the palace guards in Al Khali, responsible for the security of the Seriph and the palace grounds.
A guard stationed near the fountains in the Seriph's palace, part of the security detail for the royal residence.
A worker in the palace kitchens of Al Khali, responsible for preparing food for the Seriph and his court.
A worker responsible for maintaining the elaborate gardens of the Seriph's palace in Al Khali.
A literate servant who records the Seriph's words and handles correspondence for the palace administration.
A castrated servant who serves in the palace, traditionally used as a trusted guardian of the royal household.
An entertainer in the Seriph's palace who performs dances for the court's amusement and pleasure.
A poet who serves at the Seriph's court, composing verses to entertain the poetry-loving ruler of Al Khali.
A servant responsible for serving wine and other beverages to the Seriph and his guests during court functions.
A trader in Al Khali who sells carpets and rugs, including some with magical properties for transportation.
A seller of goods in the bustling marketplace of Al Khali, dealing with various customers and exotic merchandise.
A street performer in Al Khali who uses music to control snakes, entertaining crowds in the marketplace.
A poor person who asks for charity on the streets of Al Khali, part of the city's diverse population.
A person who manages and guides camels, used for transportation and trade in the desert regions around Al Khali.
A vendor who sells water to thirsty customers in the hot climate of Al Khali, providing an essential service.
A trader who sells lamps and lighting equipment, including some that may have magical properties or contain genies.
A seller of exotic spices and seasonings from various parts of the Disc, providing flavoring for food and potions.
A vendor who sells dates and other dried fruits, providing nutrition for travelers and locals in Al Khali.
A trader in fine silk fabrics and clothing, dealing in luxury goods for the wealthy customers of Al Khali.
A seller of precious stones and jewelry, offering valuable ornaments and possibly magical gems to customers.
A vendor who sells scented oils and perfumes, providing fragrances for personal use and religious ceremonies.
A person who claims to predict the future for customers, using various methods of divination in the Al Khali marketplace.
A servant who prepares and maintains the water pipes used for smoking in the palace and establishments of Al Khali.

15.description: One of the massive frost-covered creatures that emerges as magic runs wild. These giants are made of ice and snow.
A creature of pure flame that manifests when magic becomes uncontrolled, representing the elemental force of fire.
A supernatural entity made of water that appears as magic becomes chaotic and uncontrolled throughout the world.
A creature of stone and soil that emerges from the ground as magical forces spiral out of control.
An invisible force that manifests as wind and storm when magic becomes too powerful and unstable.

16.description: A minor supernatural entity from the dungeon dimensions that is summoned by the excessive magical activity.

9.description: The head cook in the Seriph's palace kitchen, responsible for preparing elaborate meals for the court.
A young worker who cares for the horses and other animals kept in the palace stables of Al Khali.
A craftsperson who creates the intricate carpets for which Al Khali is famous, including some with flight capabilities.

6.description: The owner and operator of a drinking establishment where travelers can find food, drink, and sometimes lodging.
A woman who works in a tavern, serving drinks and food to customers and handling the daily operations.
A regular customer at the tavern who has consumed too much alcohol and provides comic relief with slurred observations.
A member of the organized criminal organization in Ankh-Morpork that regulates thievery and related illegal activities.

19.description: A member of the guild of professional killers in Ankh-Morpork, trained in the art of elegant and expensive murder.

6.description: A member of Ankh-Morpork's city watch, responsible for maintaining order and enforcing the law in the city.
A trader who conducts business in Ankh-Morpork, dealing in various goods and services for profit.

19.description: A city worker responsible for cleaning the streets of Ankh-Morpork, dealing with the constant mess and debris.

6.description: A person who bakes bread and other baked goods for sale to the citizens of Ankh-Morpork.
A vendor who sells fish and seafood in the markets of Ankh-Morpork, dealing with the river's aquatic offerings.
A metalworker who forges tools, weapons, and other metal items for the citizens and visitors of the city.
A person who sews and repairs clothing, though in Ankh-Morpork the term sometimes has alternative meanings.

19.description: The leader of the organized beggars in Ankh-Morpork, who runs begging as a regulated business enterprise.
A person who makes a living catching and disposing of rats and other vermin in the city of Ankh-Morpork.
A person who collects human waste from the city's privies during the night hours, performing an essential but unpleasant job.
A city worker responsible for lighting and maintaining the oil lamps that provide illumination on Ankh-Morpork's streets.

6.description: A person who guides boats and ships along the Ankh River, knowing the dangerous currents and obstacles.
A laborer who works at the docks and wharves of Ankh-Morpork, loading and unloading cargo from boats.
A government official who inspects goods and collects taxes on items entering or leaving Ankh-Morpork.
The commander of a merchant vessel that travels the rivers and seas, bringing goods to and from Ankh-Morpork.
A crew member on a merchant or fishing vessel, skilled in the ways of boats and water travel.
A person who catches fish from the Ankh River for food and sale, despite the river's questionable water quality.

7.description: A legendary barbarian hero and Conina's father. Despite his advanced age, he remains one of the most feared warriors on the Disc.

8.description: A wizard from the continent of Klatch who becomes involved in the magical warfare as sourcery spreads across the world.
A wizard from the ancient city of Tsort who joins in the magical conflicts that erupt due to the Sourcerer's influence.
A wizard from the philosophical city-state of Ephebe who becomes involved in the worldwide magical conflict.

9.description: An entertainer who plays musical instruments for the court of the Seriph, providing ambiance for palace functions.

11.description: A magical being traditionally bound to serve whoever possesses its lamp, capable of granting wishes with supernatural power.
A enchanted carpet capable of flight, used as transportation by the heroes during their adventures. Has its own personality.

2.description: An ambitious wizard at Unseen University who seeks to advance his position and gain more power within the institution.
A senior wizard at Unseen University who holds the position of Senior Wrangler in the academic hierarchy.
A wizard at Unseen University who serves as part of the faculty during the sourcerer crisis.
A senior position at Unseen University, part of the administrative structure of the magical institution.
A wizard at Unseen University known for his practical approach to magic and his loud, boisterous personality.
A young wizard at Unseen University who is more interested in the practical applications of magic than most of his colleagues.

20.description: A magical computing device at Unseen University that can perform complex calculations and magical research.

21.description: A member of the order of monks who manipulate time and history to maintain the proper flow of events.
The anthropomorphic personification of Fate, who represents destiny and predetermined outcomes in the universe.

relationships.opposes: The Lady Who Must Not Be Named

the-lady.name: The Lady Who Must Not Be Named

21.description: The anthropomorphic personification of Luck and chance, who represents random events and unexpected outcomes.
The anthropomorphic personification of Time itself, responsible for the flow of temporal events across the universe.

2.description: An elderly wizard at Unseen University who has seen many changes in the institution over the years.
A recently enrolled wizard at Unseen University, still learning the basics of magic and university life.
The gatekeeper of Unseen University who controls access to the institution and knows all the university gossip.
A maintenance worker at Unseen University responsible for cleaning and basic repairs around the magical institution.
The head cook of Unseen University's kitchen, responsible for feeding the wizards and staff of the institution.
A low-level worker in the university kitchen who helps prepare meals and clean dishes for the academic community.
The person responsible for maintaining the grounds and gardens of Unseen University, including some magical plants.

4.description: An intelligent bird that lives in the Tower of Art, able to speak and observe the magical activities of the university.

2.description: A stone creature that serves as a guardian and observer at Unseen University, able to come to life when needed.
The spirit of a former wizard who died in the university and continues to haunt its halls, offering occasional advice.
A mysterious creature that lives in the plumbing of Unseen University, occasionally emerging from drains and toilets.

20.description: The preserved brain of a former wizard, kept alive in a jar to provide advice and knowledge to the university.

4.description: The supernatural entity that inhabits the Tower of Art, the tallest structure at Unseen University.

2.description: A large spider that lives in the Library of L-Space, helping to maintain the books and occasionally eating overdue borrowers.
Literal worms that eat books, particularly problematic in a magical library where they can gain knowledge from consumed texts.
An eccentric researcher at Unseen University who conducts dangerous experiments in the basement laboratories.
A brave or foolish person who helps the mad alchemist with dangerous experiments, often suffering minor explosions.

9.description: A eunuch guard who protects the Seriph's harem, skilled in combat and completely loyal to his master.
Another eunuch guard of the harem, known for his complete silence and deadly efficiency with a scimitar.
The Seriph's favorite concubine, known for her beauty and intelligence, often consulted on palace matters.
A skilled dancer among the Seriph's concubines, famous for her graceful movements and exotic performances.
A concubine with a beautiful voice who sings for the Seriph and his guests during palace entertainments.
The financial administrator of the Seriph's palace, responsible for managing the vast wealth and treasures.
An official who collects taxes and tribute from the citizens of Al Khali for the Seriph's treasury.
A legal official who administers justice in the Seriph's name, deciding criminal cases and civil disputes.
The official responsible for carrying out death sentences passed by the palace court, skilled with various implements.
An expert in extracting information and confessions through various painful methods in the palace dungeons.
A guard who watches over prisoners in the palace dungeons, ensuring they don't escape their confinement.
An unfortunate individual locked in the palace dungeons, awaiting judgment or serving a sentence.
One of the camels kept at the palace for transportation across the desert, known for its stubborn temperament.
A fine horse kept in the palace stables, used for royal processions and important journeys.
A magnificent elephant kept as a symbol of the Seriph's power and wealth, used in ceremonial processions.
A clever monkey that entertains the court with its antics and occasionally serves as an unofficial messenger.
An intelligent parrot that can speak multiple languages and sometimes repeats overheard palace secrets.
A beautiful peacock that struts through the palace gardens, admired for its magnificent plumage.
A large snake kept in the palace temple, considered sacred and fed offerings by the court.
A religious official who conducts ceremonies and rituals in the palace temple, advising on spiritual matters.
A young person learning the religious duties and ceremonies under the guidance of the palace priest.
A learned person who reads the stars and provides predictions and advice based on celestial movements.
The medical professional who tends to the health of the Seriph and his court, knowledgeable in herbs and healing.
A person who prepares medicines, potions, and remedies for the palace doctor and court.
The leader of the city guard in Al Khali, responsible for maintaining order in the streets and markets.
A member of the city watch in Al Khali, patrolling the streets and keeping peace in the bustling city.
An official who inspects goods in the Al Khali marketplace, ensuring quality and collecting fees from merchants.
An official responsible for maintaining standard weights and measures in the Al Khali marketplace.
A financial professional who exchanges foreign currencies for travelers and merchants visiting Al Khali.
The leader of a merchant caravan that travels between cities, organizing trade expeditions and protecting goods.
A warrior hired to protect merchant caravans from bandits and other dangers during their journeys.
A criminal who attacks and robs merchant caravans traveling through the desert regions around Al Khali.
A member of a wandering tribe that travels through the desert, living a traditional lifestyle.
The leader of a nomadic desert tribe, respected for wisdom and skill in surviving the harsh desert environment.

11.description: A powerful supernatural being from the elemental plane of fire, far more potent than ordinary genies.
A malevolent fire spirit with incredible power, more dangerous and less controllable than djinn.

recaps.1: Ipslore the Red, a dying wizard, binds his spirit to a staff to ensure his son becomes the most powerful wizard ever. The staff and his newborn son disappear into the night.
recaps.2: At Unseen University, the wizards go about their daily routines when a young boy with a staff arrives claiming to be a sourcerer. The wizards are skeptical but intrigued by his apparent power.
recaps.3: The boy demonstrates incredible magical abilities that far exceed normal wizardry, proving he is indeed a sourcerer. The wizards begin to realize the implications of having such power in their midst.
recaps.4: Rincewind tries to escape the university as the sourcerer's influence grows, but finds himself trapped. The Luggage becomes increasingly agitated by the magical disturbances.
recaps.5: The sourcerer, revealed to be named Coin, begins transforming Unseen University according to his father's wishes. Wizards worldwide start feeling the effects of sourcery returning to the world.
recaps.6: Rincewind escapes the university and encounters Conina, a beautiful woman with deadly fighting skills. They meet in a tavern where Conina reveals she's seeking adventure despite her fearsome abilities.
recaps.7: Conina explains she's the daughter of Cohen the Barbarian and has inherited his fighting instincts. They meet Nijel, an incompetent would-be barbarian hero who immediately falls for Conina.
recaps.8: The trio learns about the growing magical war as wizards across the Disc begin fighting each other. Conina reluctantly leads their group while Nijel tries to prove his heroic worth.
recaps.9: The heroes arrive in Al Khali, where they encounter the Seriph Creosote and his luxurious palace. The Seriph is obsessed with poetry while his Grand Vizier Abrim schemes in the background.
recaps.10: In Al Khali, magical disturbances begin affecting the city as the worldwide wizard war intensifies. The heroes witness the growing chaos caused by sourcery's return.
recaps.11: The group encounters various magical phenomena, including genies and flying carpets, as Al Khali becomes caught up in the magical upheaval spreading across the world.
recaps.12: The magical chaos in Al Khali worsens as wizards battle and reality becomes increasingly unstable. The Seriph's palace begins experiencing supernatural disturbances.
recaps.13: Strange creatures and magical anomalies appear throughout Al Khali as the sourcerer's influence spreads. The heroes realize they must take action to stop the growing magical catastrophe.
recaps.14: The magical war reaches its peak as wizards battle across multiple cities and countries. Reality begins breaking down under the strain of uncontrolled sourcery.
recaps.15: Ice Giants and other magical creatures emerge as the fabric of reality weakens. The world faces destruction as sourcery overwhelms the natural order of magic.
recaps.16: Elemental creatures and demons begin manifesting as the boundaries between dimensions weaken. The heroes witness the apocalyptic consequences of unchecked magical power.
recaps.17: The magical catastrophe reaches critical levels with reality itself beginning to unravel. Strange creatures from other dimensions start appearing across the world.
recaps.18: The world teeters on the brink of magical destruction as sourcery threatens to tear apart the very fabric of existence. The heroes realize drastic action is needed.
recaps.19: The heroes return to Ankh-Morpork to find the city affected by the magical chaos. The Patrician observes the unfolding crisis with his typical calculating demeanor.
recaps.20: At Unseen University, the final confrontation approaches as the sourcerer's power threatens to destroy everything. The Librarian and other university figures prepare for the climax.
recaps.21: The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse appear as reality nears complete collapse. Death, War, Famine, and Pestilence witness the potential end of the world.
recaps.22: In the climactic battle, the true nature of the sourcerer's power and his father's influence becomes fully apparent. The fate of magic itself hangs in the balance.
recaps.23: The crisis reaches its resolution as the sourcerer must choose between his father's vengeful plans and saving the world. The future of magic and reality depends on his decision.
